alert.note: Alert for Dickens; Motley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 21 at 8:23PM CDT until June 21 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lubbock Texas has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northeastern Dickens County in northwestern Texas... Southeastern Motley County in northwestern Texas... * Until 900 PM CDT. * At 822 PM CDT, a confirmed tornado was located 8 miles southeast of Matador, moving southeast at 20 mph. This storm has a history of producing a tornado in the City of Matador and should remain over mostly rural portions of southeastern Motley county and northeastern Dickens county. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and baseball size hail. SOURCE...Law enforcement confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include... Afton and Roaring Springs. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Heavy rainfall may hide this tornado. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
